Key Arguments: The legislation is considered dangerous and a potential threat to freedom of speech.
The draft legislation is based on outdated information from the 2021 report during the COVID-19 pandemic.
There is skepticism about the accuracy of content labeled as misinformation during the pandemic, suggesting that some of it might now be considered correct.
The government's actions during the pandemic, particularly regarding vaccines, are viewed as coercive and an abuse of power.
Concerns are raised about how 'hate speech' will be defined and regulated, particularly in relation to gender identity issues.
Notable Quotes: In my opinion this is a very dangerous piece of legislation.

It is important to have a healthy, functioning democracy and to do so, requires freedom of speech, to allow proper debate and not just silence those ideas that do not align with the Government of the day.
It was a huge abuse of power.
